distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for openjpeg2 fixes the following security issues:

- CVE-2015-1239: A double free vulnerability in the j2k_read_ppm_v3 function allowed remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) (bsc#1066713)
- CVE-2017-17479: A stack-based buffer overflow in the pgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c could crash the converter. (bsc#1072125)
- CVE-2017-17480: A stack-based buffer overflow in the pgxtovolume function in jp3d/convert.c could crash the converter. (bsc#1072124)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Double free vulnerability in the j2k_read_ppm_v3 function in OpenJPEG before r2997, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process crash) via a crafted PDF.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
